name: Tinola
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat
Add onion, ginger and 6 cloves of garlic; cook, stirring, until the onion starts to turn translucent, about 3 minutes
Add chicken and broth; cook, stirring, until the chicken is just cooked through, about 5 minutes
Add papaya (or chayote), malunggay (or bok choy), 1 tbsp fish sauce, ¼ tsp salt and pepper; continue simmering until the vegetables are tender and the flavors have melded, about 5 minutes more
Good for 1 serving

name: Tinolang Manok
instructions: Saute ginger, garlic, and onions, Add chicken pieces and water
Simmer until chicken is tender
Add chili leaves or malunggay leaves
Season with fish sauce, salt, and pepper
Good for 1 serving

name: Lumpiang Shanghai
instructions: In a bowl, mix together ground pork, carrots, spring onions, garlic, onion, salt, and pepper
Place a spoonful of the mixture onto a lumpia wrapper and roll tightly, sealing the edges with water
Heat oil in a pan and fry the lumpia until golden brown and crispy
Serve with a dipping sauce of your choice
Good for 1 serving

name: Adobong Kangkong
quantity: 1tbsp of Soy sauce”, 1tbsp of vinegar”,5pcs of Garlic
instructions: In a pan, sauté garlic and onion until fragrant
Add pork belly or chicken and cook until lightly browned
Pour soy sauce, vinegar, and add bay leaves
Simmer until meat is tender
Add kangkong and cook until wilted
Season with pepper to taste
Serve hot
Good for 1 serving

name: Sotanghon Guisado
instructions: Soak sotanghon noodles in water until softened, then drain
In a pan, sauté garlic and onion until fragrant
Add chicken and shrimp, cook until lightly browned
Add carrots and cabbage, cook until vegetables are tender
Pour soy sauce, fish sauce, and chicken broth
Bring to a simmer, Add sotanghon noodles and cook until heated through
Season with pepper to taste
Serve hot
Good for 1 serving

name: Pininyahang Manok
instructions: In a pan, sauté garlic and onion until fragrant
Add chicken pieces and cook until lightly browned
Pour coconut milk and add pineapple chunks
Simmer until chicken is cooked through and sauce thickens
Add bell pepper and season with fish sauce, salt, and pepper
Serve hot
Good for 1 serving

name: Inihaw na Pusit
quantity: Salt and ground black pepper to taste
instructions: In a bowl, mix together soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, onion, calamansi juice, salt, and pepper
Marinate squid in the mixture for at least 30 minutes
Grill squid over hot charcoal or on a grill pan until cooked and slightly charred
Baste with marinade while grilling
Serve hot
Good for 1 serving

name: Ginisang Labanos
instructions: In a pan, sauté garlic, onion, and tomatoes until softened
Add pork belly and cook until lightly browned
Add sliced radish and stir-fry until tender
Season with fish sauce, salt, and pepper
Serve hot
Good for 1 serving

name: Pinais
instructions: Season the fish with salt
Stuff the fish (Tulingan) cavity with lemongrass, ginger, and tomatoes
Wrap the fish in banana leaves securely
Steam the wrapped fish until cooked
Good for 1 serving

name: Pochero
instructions: Sauté garlic and onions in a pot
Add the beef and brown on all sides
Pour in tomato sauce and enough water to cover the beef
Simmer until beef is tender, Add potatoes, carrots, cabbage and saba bananas
Cook until vegetables are tender
Season with salt and pepper to taste
Good for 1 serving

name: Salmon-Stuffed Avocados
quantity: 1 pinch of salt and ground black pepper
instructions: Combine yogurt, celery, parsley, lime juice, mayonnaise, mustard, salt, and pepper in a medium bowl, mix well
Add salmon and mix well
Halve avocados lengthwise and remove pits
Scoop about 1 tablespoon flesh from each avocado half into a small bowl
Mash the scooped-out avocado flesh with a fork and stir into the salmon mixture.
Fill each avocado half with about 1/4 cup of the salmon mixture, mounding it on top of the avocado halves
Garnish with chives, if desired.
Good for 1 serving

name: Avocado Deviled Eggs
quantity: 1 tablespoon sour cream (can skip if you need dairy free)
1 tablespoon chopped chives or green onion
instructions: Carefully remove egg yolks from egg whites using a spoon
place the yolks in a medium bowl
Place egg white halves on a large plate
Add avocado, 2 tablespoons chives, mayonnaise, lime juice, mustard, paprika and salt to the bowl with the egg yolks
Mix and mash thoroughly with a fork until smooth
Spoon the egg yolk mixture evenly into each egg white half (about 1 tablespoon each)
(Alternatively, place the egg yolk mixture in a pastry bag, or a zip-top bag with a 1/4-inch corner cut off, and pipe the filling into the egg white halves)
Garnish each egg half with bacon (if using), pickled red onions and the remaining 1 tablespoon chives, Sprinkle with crushed red pepper, if desired
Good for 1 serving

name: Pistachio & Peach Toast
instructions: Combine ricotta
½ teaspoon honey and cinnamon in a small bowl
Spread the ricotta mixture on toast and top with peach and pistachios
Drizzle with the remaining 1/2 teaspoon honey
Good for 1 serving

name: Sheet-Pan Sausage & Peppers
quantity: 2 chopped bell pepper and red onion
1 tsp of black pepper”, “1 pinch of black pepper”, “2 tbsp of kosher”, “3 cloves of garlic”, “2 grated parmesan cheese
instructions: Place a large rimmed baking sheet in oven
preheat oven to 425 degrees F
Toss together onion, bell peppers, fennel, oil, black pepper and salt in a large bowl
Arrange vegetable mixture in a single layer on preheated baking sheet
Bake in preheated oven until vegetables begin to soften, about 10 minutes
Remove baking sheet from oven and toss vegetable mixture
Add sausage and garlic to baking sheet
Return to oven, and bake at 425 degrees F until sausage is warmed through and vegetables are tender, about 15 minutes
Remove from oven; sprinkle with cheese, basil and crushed red pepper
Good for 1 serving

name: Sheet-Pan Sausage & Peppers
quantity: 2 chopped bell pepper and red onion
1 tsp of black pepper”, “1 pinch of black pepper
2 tbsp of kosher”, “3 cloves of garlic”, “2 grated parmesan cheese
instructions: Place a large rimmed baking sheet in oven
preheat oven to 425 degrees F
Toss together onion, bell peppers, fennel, oil, black pepper and salt in a large bowl
Arrange vegetable mixture in a single layer on preheated baking sheet
Bake in preheated oven until vegetables begin to soften, about 10 minutes
Remove baking sheet from oven and toss vegetable mixture
Add sausage and garlic to baking sheet
Return to oven, and bake at 425 degrees F until sausage is warmed through and vegetables are tender, about 15 minutes
Remove from oven; sprinkle with cheese, basil and crushed red pepper
Good for 1 serving

name: Peanut Butter & Berries Waffle Sandwich (This recipe may have a potential high fat content.)
quantity: ¼ cup fresh mixed berries, such as raspberries, strawberries and blackberries
instructions: Slice waffle in half down the center
Spread peanut butter over one half
Place berries in a small bowl and smash with the back of a fork
Spread on top of the peanut butter layer and then drizzle with honey
Top with the remaining waffle half
Good for 1 serving

name: Laing
quantity: 1/2 cup shrimp paste bagoong or balaw
instructions: Combine the coconut milk, pork, shrimp paste, ginger, onion, and garlic in a cooking pot
Heat the pot and let boil
Once the mixture starts to boil, gently stir to mix the ingredients
Cover the pot and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes
Make sure to stir once in a while to prevent the ingredients from sticking on the bottom of the cooking pot
Add the dried taro leaves
Do not stir, Let it stay until the leaves absorb the coconut milk
This takes about 20 to 30 minutes
You can gently push the leaves down so that it can absorb more coconut milk
Once the leaves absorb the coconut milk, stir the leaves and then continue to cook for to 10 minutes
Pour the coconut cream into the cooking pot
Add the red chilies
Stir, Cook for 10 to 12 minutes
Transfer to a serving plate, Serve
Good for 1 serving

name: Ginisang Ampalaya
quantity: 2 chopped onions”, “2 chopped tomatoes”, “1 pinch of salt and black pepper”, “2 tbsp of cooking oil
instructions: Slice the bitter melon into thin, half crescent shaped pieces
Now soak the bitter melon in salted water for 10 minutes
Remove the bitter melon from the salt water and squeeze it with your hands slightly to remove some of the bitter taste
Then rinse the bitter melon and set it aside
In a bowl, beat the eggs and season with salt to taste
Add the cooking oil to a large pan over medium-high heat
Now add the garlic and onion and stir occasionally
Saute this for a minute then add the tomato
Saute for another minute then add the bitter melon
Stir occasionally until the bitter melon is tender but do not overcook
Pour the eggs into the pan then stir
Cook this until eggs are scrambled
Remove the pan from the heat and serve the food on a serving dish
Good for 1 serving

name: Bulanglang
quantity: 1 pinch of salt and black pepper
instructions: In a pot add oil and pork then cook until brown and crispy
Remove from pot then set aside
Add garlic and onion and sauté for a minute; add tomatoes and sauté until it becomes soft
Add butternut squash stir fry for 2 minutes
Add bottle grourd and okra then stir fry for 2 minutes
Add loofah then stir fry for 2 minutes
Pour in rice wash then add the browned pork, shrimps, bagoong and spinach / moringa leaves, bring to a boil and simmer for 5 minutes or until vegetables are cooked
Season with freshly ground black pepper then serve
Good for 1 serving

name: Scrambled Egg Toast
quantity: ½ tbsp butter, plus more to butter the bread
instructions: Spread a thin layer of softened butter on both sides of the bread
Fry the bread over medium heat for about 2 minutes on each side, until a golden brown crust forms
Alternatively, you can use a toaster or toaster oven to toast your bread
Remove the bread from the frying pan and add ½ tbsp, of butter
Add the eggs, and cook, add a pinch of salt for flavor on medium-low heat, stirring often, for about 3-4 minutes, until the eggs are cooked through
Divide the eggs between the bread slices and garnish as you desire
Good for 1 serving

name: Lemon Chicken
instructions: Make a marinade of ½ lemon juice, 3 green chillies, 1 tbsp ginger garlic paste, salt and pepper
Marinate the chicken in the marinade
Heat up a pan and add oil onto it
Fry the marinated chicken in the oil for 5 minutes
Once done, remove from heat and serve into a plate
Good for 1 serving

name: Chocolate Banana Oatmeal
instructions: Bring water and a pinch of regular salt to a boil in a small saucepan
Stir in oats, reduce heat to medium and cook, stirring occasionally, until most of the liquid is absorbed, about 5 minutes
Remove from heat, cover and let stand for 2 to 3 minutes
Top with banana, chocolate spread and flaky salt
Good for 1 serving

name: Pork Menudo
quantity: 2 to 3 pieces dried bay leaves”,Salt and pepper to taste
instructions: Combine pork, soysauce, and lemon in a bowl
Marinate for at least 1 hour,Heat oil in a pan
Saute garlic and onion,Add the marinated pork
Cook for 5 to 7 minutes
Pour in tomato sauce and water and then add the bay leaves
Let boil and simmer for 30 minutes to an hour depending on the toughness of the pork
Note: Add water as necessary,Add-in the liver and hot dogs
Cook for 5 minutes
Put-in potatoes, carrots, sugar,salt, and pepper
Stir and cook for 8 to 12 minutes
Good for 1 serving

name: Simple Scrambled Eggs with Spinach and Cheese
instructions: Pour in the 3 whisked eggs and cook, stirring occasionally, until almost set
Sprinkle cheese over the eggs and continue cooking until the cheese melts
Serve hot
Good for 1 serving

name: Ginisang Gulay
instructions: Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a pan over medium heat
Add 2 cloves of garlic and 1 onion, and sauté until fragrant
Add 2 cups mixed vegetables and cook until tender yet still crisp
Season with salt and pepper to taste
Serve hot as a side dish or with brown rice for a complete meal
Good for 1 serving

name: Lumpiang Gulay
quantity: 1 tbsp of soy sauce and oyster sauce
instructions: Heat the oil in a large pan over medium heat
Add the onion and garlic and sauté until softened
Add the cabbage, carrot, jicama, green beans, and bean sprouts
Cook for 5-7 minutes or until the vegetables are tender
Season with salt, pepper, soy sauce, and oyster sauce
In a small bowl, mix together the cornstarch and water
Add it to the pan and stir to combine
Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes or until the sauce has thickened
Remove the pan from the heat and let the filling cool
Wrap the filling in lumpia wrappers and deep-fry them until golden brown
In a small bowl, mix together the sweet chili sauce and white vinegar
Serve the Lumpiang Gulay with the sweet chili vinegar dipping sauce
Good for 1 serving

name: Ginisang Monggo
instructions: In a pan, put-in the water and bring to a boil
Put-in the Mung beans and simmer until becomes soft (about 35 to 50 minutes), On a separate pan, sauté the garlic,onion, and tomato
Add the pork
Cook for 5 mins
Put-in the beef cube and fish sauce
Simmer for 10 mins or until the meat is tender
Note: If necessary, you may add water to help make the meat tender but make sure to add more time to simmer
Add the shrimp
Stir and then cook for 2 minutes
Pour the cooked Mung beans
Stir and then simmer for 10 minutes, Add the spinach and pork rinds (chicharon)
Sprinkle the ground black pepper
Serve hot, Share and Enjoy!
Good for 1 serving

name: Banana Pancakes
instructions: Mash ripe bananas and mix them with 1 cup of flour, 2 eggs, 1 cup of milk, and a pinch of baking powder until you have a smooth batter
Cook the pancakes on a hot griddle or frying pan until golden brown on both sides
Serve it with toppings of butter
Good for 1 serving

name: Chicken and Cabbage Club Sandwich
instructions: Cook chicken breasts until fully cooked and slice them thinly
Toast bread slices and assemble the sandwich with layers of sliced chicken, shredded cabbage and top it all of mayonnaise
Good for 1 serving

name: Lemon Garlic Shrimp
instructions: In a bowl, combine lemon zest, lemon juice, minced garlic, salt, and pepper
Add the shrimp to the bowl and mix well to ensure the shrimp is well coated
Heat a pan over medium heat and add a little bit of oil
Add the shrimp mixture to the pan and cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side or until the shrimp is pink and fully cooked
Serve the shrimp with your favorite vegetables to keep it lower carb, or with your favorite rice or pasta
Good for 1 serving

name: Lechon Paksiw
quantity: 4 lbs. leftover Lechon or Lechon kawali
instructions: In a pot, combine vinegar, soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic, onion, bay leaves, pepper, and salt
Add chopped lechon pieces to the pot
Simmer until the meat is tender and the sauce is thickened
Good for 1 serving

name: Vegetable Stir-Fry
instructions: Slice bell peppers, zucchini, mushrooms, and onions
Stir-fry vegetables in a pan with soy sauce
Cook until vegetables are tender
Good for 1 serving

name: Adobong sitaw
quantity: 1 lb string beans sitaw, cut in 2 inch length
instructions: In a pan, heat oil then add onions and garlic
When onion and garlic turns golden brown (not burnt), add the pork and stir occasionally until the pork is fully cooked
Add soy sauce and vinegar, Let it simmer
Once the mixture is simmering, add the string beans and stir slowly, allowing the sauce to fully incorporate with the string beans
Add salt and pepper according to your taste
Let it simmer for about 3-5 minutes more until the sitaw is tender, (Be careful not to let the string beans get overcooked!),Serve with hot steamed rice!
Good for 1 serving

name: Filipino chicken curry
quantity: 2 lbs. chicken cut into serving pieces
fish sauce and ground black pepper
instructions: Heat oil in a pan
Fry potato for 1 minute per side, Remove from the pan
Set aside
Using the remaining oil, saute garlic, onion, celery, and ginger until onion softens
Add the chicken pieces
Saute until the outer part of the chicken turns light brown
Add 1 tablespoon fish sauce
Continue sautéing for 1 minute,Pour-in coconut milk and water, Let boil
Add curry powder
Stir until the powder is completely diluted
Cover the pot and continue cooking between low to medium heat until the liquid reduces to half
Add the red bell pepper and pan fried-potato
Cook for 5 minutes
Season with fish sauce and ground black pepper as needed
You can also add all-purpose cream if desired
Good for 1 serving
